isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Thermostatic Expansion Valve (TXV) System, March 2007 and Later - REMOVE AND INSTALL - BLOWER SCROLL HOUSING

svcprocinfo.para: The blower scroll housing must be removed prior to removing the heater core, the heater core housing, or any of the components within the blower scroll housing. Accessing the blower scroll housing may require the removal of trim panels not described in this manual.

step1.para:
Remove fuse panel cover, other trim covers (as necessary), and heater trim cover. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, HEATER TRIM COVER
.

note.para: Refer to Figure 30 while performing the following steps.

step1.para: Disconnect electrical plug connected to the temperature door actuator (6, Figure 30).
Remove four screws securing blower scroll housing (3) to heater housing assembly (1).

note.para: In the following step wiring connections to linear power module and blower motor must be disconnected once blower scroll housing is partially separated from heater housing.

step1.para: Carefully separate blower scroll housing (3) from heater housing (1).
With blower scroll housing removed, blower assembly (8), linear power module (7), and heater core (2) are accessible for service.

When replacing a damaged scroll housing, transfer all good components: blower assembly, linear power module, and temperature door actuator (6), from damaged housing to new housing. Refer to appropriate procedures in this manual for additional information.

note.para: Refer to Figure 30 while performing the following steps.
Depending on the level of disassembly required for the repair, some of the following steps may not be necessary for each installation.

step1.para: If removed previously, install blower assembly (8, Figure 30), using three screws.
If removed previously, install linear power module (7) and LPM cover (10), using two screws.

If temperature door actuator was removed previously, install actuator by rotating door until flats on door shaft align with actuator drive collar, if possible; then carefully slip the actuator (6) onto end of door shaft so that mounting holes are properly aligned. If actuator drive collar must be moved to allow alignment:

step2.para: Place actuator into its approximate position.

To rotate drive collar, connect a 9 Volt battery across the active pins of the actuator connector (check mating connector if necessary). (Reverse connection to rotate drive collar in opposite direction.)
Allow drive collar to rotate until it is aligned with door shaft, and actuator mounting screws can be inserted. Then, disconnect battery.

step1.para: Secure actuator to blower scroll housing (3) using two screws.

Before installing blower scroll housing, verify that heater core (2) is installed in heater housing (1). To install the heater core refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, HEATER CORE
.

Position blower scroll housing so that electrical connections to linear power module and blower motor can be connected. After making connection, secure any excess wire so that it will not interfere with installation of blower scroll housing.

note.para: When installing the blower scroll housing in the following step, pay close attention to how the edges of the housing walls mate up with the walls of the heater housing.

step1.para: Carefully install blower scroll housing so that housing walls interlock with walls of heater housing, and mounting holes line up.
Secure blower scroll housing (3) to heater housing using four screws.
Connect electrical control plug to temperature blend door actuator (6).
Install heater trim cover, other trim covers (as necessary), and fuse panel cover. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, HEATER TRIM COVER, .
